com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins
Class SqlBlobSource

java.lang.Object
  com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins.SyncPlugin
      com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins.SourcePlugin
          com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins.MultithreadedGraphSource
              com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins.SqlBlobSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class SqlBlobSource
extends MultithreadedGraphSource

Implements a source plugin that reads BLOB objects from a SQL table, migrates them to Atmos, and then updates another (possibly same) table with the new Atmos identifier. Due to this source's complexity, it may be easiest to configure this source using Spring. See spring/sqlsource.xml for a sample.

Source Properties:
dataSource
The javax.sql.DataSource to use for connections
selectSql
The query to execute to select objects to copy to Atmos
sourceBlobColumn
The column within the sourceQuery that contains the BLOB data
sourceIdColumn
The column within the sourceQuery that contains the object identifier
sourceAtmosIdColumn
(Optional) If specified, the Atmos objectID will be fetched from this column. If non-empty, this will be used as the Atmos Object identifier and the object will be updated inside Atmos instead of creating a new object. Note that if this property is omitted, every object will be a new create operation even over multiple runs.
metadataMapping
(Optional) If specified, the specified columns will be read from the select data and used as Atmos metadata.
metadataTrim
(Default=true) If true, any metadata read from the source will be trimmed. This is useful when data is read from databases with fixed-length CHAR columns to remove extra spaces
updateSql
(Optional) The query to execute after storing data in Atmos. this is used to store the Atmos ID in the database. This could also set the BLOB column to null to release the data.
updateIdColumn
This is the column to set with the value read from sourceIdColumn during the select operation
updateAtmosIdColumn
This is the column to set the new Atmos ID in

Author:
cwikj

run

public void run()
Description copied from class: SourcePlugin
Starts execution of the source. This should determine the objects to transfer, create SyncObjects for them, and send them down the pluign chain. Once all objects have completed transferring, this method should return.

validateChain

public void validateChain(SyncPlugin first)
Description copied from class: SyncPlugin
If this plugin is to be included in the process, this method will be called just before processing starts. All of the plugins will have been confgured at this point. This gives the plugin a last chance to inspect all of the other plugins present and throw an exception if some sort of incompatibility has been discovered. For instance, if this plugin only supports Atmos destinations in object mode, it could traverse the plugin chain (via getNext()) until it reaches the source and then validate that the source is an AtmosDestination and that the destination's namespaceRoot is null.

Specified by:
validateChain in class SyncPlugin
Parameters:
first - the first plugin in the chain.
See Also:
SyncPlugin.validateChain(com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins.SyncPlugin)
